LEGAL_ACCEPTANCE_TEXT: By accessing and using Portfolio (Product), you acknowledge and agree to the following terms and conditions, and any policies, guidelines, or amendments thereto that may be presented to you from time to time. LEGAL_SCOPE_TITLE: Scope and ownership of the product
LEGAL_SCOPE_TEXT: Portfolio has been developed as part of a student group project in a web development bootcamp at the Developer Akademie GmbH. It has an educational purpose and is not intended for extensive personal & business usage. As such, we cannot guarantee consistent availability, reliability, accuracy, or any other aspect of quality regarding this Product. The design of Portfolio is owned by the Developer Akademie GmbH. Unauthorized use, reproduction, modification, distribution, or replication of the design is strictly prohibited.
LEGAL_PROPRIETARY_TEXT: Aside from the design owned by Developer Akademie GmbH, we, the listed students, retain all proprietary rights in Portfolio, including any associated copyrighted material, trademarks, and other proprietary information.
LEGAL_USE_TEXT: Portfolio is intended to be used for lawful purposes only, in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations. Any use of Portfolio for illegal activities, or to harass, harm, threaten, or intimidate another person, is strictly prohibited. You are solely responsible for your interactions with other users of Portfolio.
LEGAL_DISCLAIMER_TITLE: Disclaimer of warranties and limitation of liability
LEGAL_DISCLAIMER_TEXT: Portfolio is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind, whether express or implied, including but not limited to the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. In no event will we, the listed students, or the Developer Akademie, be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data, or other intangible losses, even if we have been advised of the possibility of such damages, arising out of or in connection with the use or performance of Portfolio.
LEGAL_INDEMNITY_TEXT: You agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless us, the listed students, the Developer Akademie, and our affiliates, partners, officers, directors, agents, and employees, from and against any claim, demand, loss, damage, cost, or liability (including reasonable legal fees) arising out of or relating to your use of Portfolio and/or your breach of this Legal Notice. For any questions or notices, please contact us at davideisenbarth@gmail.com. Date: January 14, 2026
PRIVACY_SECTION1_GENERAL_TEXT: The following information provides a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data is any data with which you can be personally identified.
PRIVACY_SECTION1_COLLECTION_TEXT1: Data processing is carried out by the website operator. Contact details can be found below.
PRIVACY_SECTION1_COLLECTION_TEXT2: Your data is collected when you provide it to us (e.g. via contact forms). Other data is collected automatically or after your consent by our IT systems (e.g. browser type, operating system, time of page access).
PRIVACY_SECTION1_COLLECTION_TEXT3: To ensure proper operation of the website and to process inquiries.
PRIVACY_SECTION1_COLLECTION_TEXT4: You have the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability, and to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
PRIVACY_SECTION2_TEXT1: This website is hosted externally. Personal data is stored on the servers of the hosting provider.
PRIVACY_SECTION4_TEXT: This website uses cookies. Cookies are small text files stored on your device. Essential cookies are processed based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR.
PRIVACY_SECTION5_TEXT: If you contact us via a form, your data will be stored for processing your request. Your data will not be shared without your consent.
PRIVACY_SECTION6_TEXT: This website uses social media plugins (e.g. Facebook) via the privacy-friendly Shariff solution. Data transfer only occurs after explicit consent.
PRIVACY_SECTION7_TEXT: Google Fonts are hosted locally. No connection to Google servers is established.
WHY_ME_DESCRIPTION: I am passionate about programming because it combines analytical thinking with creativity. Frontend development especially motivates me, as it allows me to turn technical solutions into user-friendly and visually appealing interfaces. Challenges encourage me to think in a solution-oriented way and to work persistently until problems are resolved. Through my training as a Frontend Developer, I have also learned the importance of teamwork and collaboration in order to create efficient and well-structured solutions together.
SKILLS_LEARNING_TEXT: I am motivated to continually improve my skills, implement innovative solutions and stay up to date with new technologies.
CONTACT_DESCRIPTION: Feel free to get in touch with job offers or opportunities such as freelance work, permanent roles, or collaborations. I am interested in contributing my skills to meaningful projects and adding value through reliable, high-quality work.
FORM_PRIVACY_TEXT_AFTER: and agree to the processing of my data as outlined.
TESTIMONIALS_TITLE: Need a team player? Here’s what my colleagues say about me
TESTIMONIAL_Subtitle_MOBILE: Here you can learn more about my colleagues and their experiences
TESTIMONIAL_1_TEXT: David had to develop, format and deliver content in a single project. He is a reliable and friendly person.
TESTIMONIAL_2_TEXT: David is a reliable and friendly person. He works in a structured way and writes clean code. I recommend him as a colleague.
TESTIMONIAL_3_TEXT: He is a trustworthy team player and can cope well with deadline pressure. Structured work and clean code.

ABOUT.TITLE: About the project
ABOUT.CONTENT: This App is a self-built Pokédex App. It provides a comprehensive overview of Pokémon with detailed information, intuitive navigation, and a clean user interface, all developed independently to showcase strong problem-solving skills, structured data handling, and attention to detail.

WORK.TITLE: How I have organised my work process
WORK.CONTENT: My workflow was carefully structured and self-managed. I planned features step by step, broke down complex tasks into manageable parts, and continuously tested and refined the application to ensure clean code, reliability, and steady progress throughout the project.

LEARNED.TITLE: What I have learned
LEARNED.CONTENT: Through this project, I significantly expanded my skill set. I improved my ability to work independently, deepened my understanding of structured data handling and component-based development, and gained valuable experience in planning, problem-solving, and building scalable applications from scratch.

ABOUT.TITLE: About the project
ABOUT.CONTENT: A simple Jump-and-Run game based on an object-oriented approach. Help Pepe to find coins and poison bottles to fight against the killer chicken.

WORK.TITLE: How I have organised my work process
WORK.CONTENT: The application is object-oriented and divided into clear classes such as player, enemy, items, and game world. Descriptive names for files, variables, and methods make the code easy to understand. Key functions are concisely documented, and the clear structure allows for easy extension or customization of game mechanics such as coins or poison bottles.

LEARNED.TITLE: What I have learned
LEARNED.CONTENT: Through this project, I significantly expanded my skill set. I improved my ability to work independently, deepened my understanding of structured data handling and component-based development, and gained valuable experience in planning, problem-solving, and building scalable applications from scratch.

ABOUT.TITLE: About the project
ABOUT.CONTENT: Task manager inspired by the Kanban System. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.

WORK.TITLE: How I have organised my work process
WORK.CONTENT: In our group project with HTML, CSS, and Java, we structured the code clearly and maintainably. The application is divided into distinct areas (structure, design, logic). We use descriptive names for files, variables, and classes and document important parts in the code. Simple tests and peer code reviews ensure quality and clarity.

LEARNED.TITLE: What I have learnt
LEARNED.CONTENT: There were three of us on the team, and the roles were evenly distributed. My main responsibilities were on the task management, notice board, legal notice, and privacy policy pages. It was a great collaboration and a successful project.

ABOUT.TITLE: About the project
ABOUT.CONTENT: This App is a Slack Clone App. It revolutionizes team communication and collaboration with its intuitive interface, real-time messaging, and robust channel organization. Show a desire to learn new technologies and continually improve your skills.
